main event: Unidentified object sighted over Oak Ridge, Tennessee on multiple occasions between January 16 and January 25, 1951.
interesting points: On January 21, 1951, radar tracked an unidentified object for approximately 30 minutes., An object was reported moving at an estimated speed of 400-600 mph before disappearing., Observers thought a bluish-colored object was stationary but it was not accounted for., There were multiple conclusions drawn, including it possibly being a balloon or aircraft., Atmospheric conditions of temperature inversions may have caused misidentification of radar targets.
witness description: Pilot and navigator of the aircraft
